_description: Signs of Death — six lines, translating the Latin, ‘Oculi cum occultentur…’

CamTCC323.First Lines:
Wenne þin eyen beit ihut& þin heren beoit
                    idut…
CamTCC323.Last Lines: …ant lute þad wllit to þine soule ben holde
CamTCC323.Note: Written two lines of verse per line in manuscript.
CamTCC323.Editions:
Person,  Henry Axel. 
             Cambridge Middle English Lyrics.
         Seattle: University of Washington Press, 1953; rev. ed. 1962: 21.
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “Signs of Death in Middle English.” 
             Mediaeval Studies
         32 (1970): 282-98: 291.
